reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Ebola Preparedness Workshop / Global Disease Surveillance SMEE

description.narrative: This minimal cost project will provide financial support to conduct an Ebola Preparedness Workshop and Global Disease Surveillance Subject Matter Exchange. Medical experts from the United States and Uruguay will travel to Santiago and take part in an Governmental Interagency panel exchange where medical doctors will share lessons learned and best practices dealing with Ebola, preparing the medical community, interagency coordination, deployment of medical capabilities for the treatment of Ebola patients, managing Ebola patients, and the regional leadership role Chile can assume in Global Disease Surveillance in the AOR.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Chile is a regional strategic partner in peacekeeping activities, training both civilian and military personnel from Latin America at its peacekeeping training center and attaching peacekeeping platoons from other countries to its own large and professional force. U.S. assistance will support Chile's efforts to modernize and enhance its military's capacity to participate in regional security and peacekeeping operations, and increase interoperability with U.S. forces. U.S. assistance will also help to combat the spread of weapons of mass destruction and the transfer of dangerous contraband as Chile develops a comprehensive export control system that meets international standards. Additionally, U.S. assistance will support technical exchanges and training relevant to the establishment and enforcement of export control laws.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Overseas Humanitarian, Disaster, and Civic Aid, Defense
